page.title: 01INTRODUCTION.
page.content: This is a rural area containing the 3 small villages of Staplefield, Warninglid and Slaugham. It is predominantly agricultural with farms scattered evenly over the area. There are quite a lot of fairly large houses although most of the residences tend to be centred near the 3 villages.As the area is near the two major population centres of Crawley and Haywards Heath it is visited by many people who enjoy the countryside walks,quaint pubs, ponds, woods and the general quietness. Staplefield is a small village situated in the east of the area. It consists of a number of houses centred around a common.There are two public houses, a primary school, a school for handicapped children, protestant church, catholic chapel, village hall and voluntary shop.
